Blog About

Sushovan Majhi

I am a fifth year PhD student in the mathematics department at Tulane University. I spend most of my time solving math and coding problems. I am also involved in a few start-up projects. I read books and play classical guitar in my spare time.

TEACHING
Alongside my research and course work, I enjoy teaching mathematics and statistics courses at Tulane University. Here is a list of my courses.

Statistics for Business (2019)

RESEARCH
For my PhD thesis, I work in the interface of mathematics and computer science under the supervision of Prof. Carola Wenk. Broadly speaking, my research interest lies in Topological Data Analysis . The follwing is a list of my research groups/topics that I am currently involved in.

Map Construction

Road-map reconstruction from GPS trajectory data is a challenging problem in computational geometry. See mapconstruction.org

Map Distance

Morse Theory

Download my CV.
